data.description: Implements an auto-containment of available assets and identities found in artifacts with high risk scores or confirmed threats.

1.userCode:

workbook_add.description: Add a workbook to a container. Provide a container id and a workbook name or id

fields.description: Defaults to True. Check to see if workbook already exists in container before adding.
fields.label: check_for_existing_workbook
fields.name: check_for_existing_workbook

fields.description: Defaults to True. Sets the added workbook to the current phase.
fields.label: start_workbook
fields.name: start_workbook

workbook_add.label: workbook_add
workbook_add.name: workbook_add

mark_evidence.description: Mark an object as Evidence in a container

fields.description: The object to mark as evidence. This could be a vault_id, artifact_id, note_id, container_id, or action_run_id. If the previous playbook block is an action then "keyword_argument:results" can be used for the action_run_id with the content_type "action_run_id". Vault_id can be an ID or a vault hash.
fields.label: input_object
fields.name: input_object
fields.placeholder: artifact id, note id, vault_id, etc.

fields.description:
The content type of the object to add as evidence which must be one of the following:
            
            vault_id
            artifact_id
            container_id
            note_id
            action_run_id
fields.label: content_type
fields.name: content_type
fields.placeholder: See help text for supported types

mark_evidence.label: mark_evidence
mark_evidence.name: mark_evidence

advanced.description: Finds artifacts with a notable event_id
advanced.note: Finds artifacts with a notable event_id

advanced.description: Updates Splunk Enterprise Security with a containment action note.
advanced.note: Updates Splunk Enterprise Security with a containment action note.

indicator_collect.description: Collect all indicators in a container and separate them by data type. Additional output data paths are created for each data type. Artifact scope is ignored.

fields.description: Optional parameter to only look for indicator values that occur in the artifacts with these IDs. Must be one of: json serializable list, comma separated integers, or a single integer.
fields.label: artifact_ids_include
fields.name: artifact_ids_include

fields.description: Optional parameter to only include indicators with at least one of the provided types in the output. If left empty, all indicator types will be included except those that are explicitly excluded. Accepts a comma-separated list.
fields.label: indicator_types_include
fields.name: indicator_types_include

fields.description: Optional parameter to exclude indicators with any of the provided types from the output. Accepts a comma-separated list.
fields.label: indicator_types_exclude
fields.name: indicator_types_exclude

fields.description: Optional parameter to only include indicators with at least one of the provided tags in the output. If left empty, tags will be ignored except when they are excluded. Accepts a comma-separated list.
fields.label: indicator_tags_include
fields.name: indicator_tags_include

fields.description: Optional parameter to exclude indicators with any of the provided tags from the output. Accepts a comma-separated list.
fields.label: indicator_tags_exclude
fields.name: indicator_tags_exclude

indicator_collect.label: indicator_collect
indicator_collect.name: indicator_collect

indicator_collect.indicator_types_include: user, user name, username, user_name, host, host name, hostname, host_name

advanced.description: Format a custom report based on which playbooks were dispatched
advanced.note: Format a custom report based on which playbooks were dispatched

workbook_task_update.description: Update a workbook task by task name

fields.description: Assigns task to provided owner. Accepts keyword 'current" to assign task to currently running playbook user. (Optional)
fields.label: owner
fields.name: owner

workbook_task_update.label: workbook_task_update
workbook_task_update.name: workbook_task_update

workbook_add.description: Add a workbook to a container. Provide a container id and a workbook name or id

fields.description: Defaults to True. Check to see if workbook already exists in container before adding.
fields.label: check_for_existing_workbook
fields.name: check_for_existing_workbook

fields.description: Defaults to True. Sets the added workbook to the current phase.
fields.label: start_workbook
fields.name: start_workbook

workbook_add.label: workbook_add
workbook_add.name: workbook_add

workbook_task_update.description: Update a workbook task by task name

fields.description: Assigns task to provided owner. Accepts keyword 'current" to assign task to currently running playbook user. (Optional)
fields.label: owner
fields.name: owner

workbook_task_update.label: workbook_task_update

data.notes:
- Change "high_risk_artifact_filter" as needed to control which artifacts are sent to containment
- For detailed implementation see https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/ESSOC/latest/user/Useplaybookpack
